alert.note: Alert for Banner (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 6:41PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Cheyenne, southern Morrill and east central Banner Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 540 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Redington, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bridgeport, Northport, The Intersection Of Highway 385 And 92, Court House And Jail Rocks, Bridgeport State Recreation Area, Angora, Redington, The Intersection Of Highway 385 And L62 and Broadwater. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
